name: Inn at Sonoma, A Four Sisters Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Inn at Sonoma during the last two nights of our week-long stay in wine country to celebrate our first anniversary. What an Inn!! The staff is friendly, the property is beautiful and clean, and filled with charm.
reviews.title: Charming Inn, great location!

likes.liked: — Great location, awesome extras, lots of homey touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are tons of great touches that make this hotel an excellent value. For example, there's free wine and appetizers each night in the lobby. The staff gave us free wine tasting coupons for literally every vineyard that was on our list. There are great bikes available to guests for free, and free sodas, water, coffee, and fresh-baked cookies in the lobby all the time.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Experience....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast is extensive, with two hot items each morning (a quiche and a hashbrown dish) cereal, breads, yogurt, etc. We also got the newspaper each morning. Our room was lovely, with charming details that had modern twists, like a gas fireplace (we only had to flip a switch!). We also had a DVD player (with free movies available at the front desk) and a great patio with table and chairs. Wireless internet is also free (my husband appreciated being able to set his fantasy baseball team in the morning. Men.)
reviews.title: Great value, great hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time, and although I originally thought the price was on the high side ($215 for Thursday night; $270 for Friday) I quickly learned what a bargain that is in wine country where a basic motel room goes for close to $200 a night.
reviews.title: Don't pass this up - you will miss something special

reviews.text: If I had one complaint, it would be that the staff- while incredibly nice- seems a bit inexperienced. We arrived early and when I asked if our room was by any chance ready, the woman kind of blinked at me and said "Check in isn't until 3." I said it was fine and could we store our luggage somewhere, and she just seemed kind of confused. Other than that, they were all very friendly and helpful. We'll be back.
reviews.title: I love this place!!!
Great Place
reviews.text: I stayed at The Inn at Sonoma for 2 nights the first week in October with my boyfriend. It was in a great location, walking distance to the square and restaurants. The breakfast was yummy, we loved the egg dish each morning! The front desk was able to get us a reservation at the Girl and the Fig at the last minute and we had the best meal of our trip there. We would definitely stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the hotel after reading other reviews and was not disappointed. The staff was very friendly and explained all of the details for us; from the daily, home-made cookies, the in-room fire-place, the roof-top hot tub, to the movies and bikes they lend. Location was great... very near the old square. Our room was ready for us when we arrived in the late afternoon and after borrowing bikes to look around town and have dinner, we returned later to the sheets being turned down for us (complete with the room's mascot tucked in). The included breakfast was delicious. I would definitely go out of my way to stay there again.
reviews.title: The Extra Touch

reviews.text: To be fair the hotel was clean and quiet. But for $628.00 for 2 nights lodging I do not want to be next to a gas station. If I am in the wine country I want to be in the country looking at vineyards.
reviews.title: If you like a view of the Shell gas station stay here

likes.liked: — clean and updated except for the comforters, I like white
likes.disliked: — Shell station views ,no services Chucky teddie bear theme

reviews.text: We also did not like that no one is available after 8:00 p.m. if you need something or have a problem. There is a sign on the door that says in an emergency call 911!! I like a larger property with more services. I also hated that they turned your bed down and stuck a teddy bear under the covers. Creepy , like a Chuckie movie, too many Teddy bears to suit me. I think you are better off staying in Napa or Yountville closer to vineyards and in the country.
reviews.title: Still miss the Inn at Sonoma

likes.liked: — Comfortable & attractive room, helpful & friendly staff, perfect location

reviews.text: I returned a few days ago from 3 weeks of touring California. My stay at the Inn at Sonoma was the highlight of my trip. It's the first time I've found accomodations with the friendliness & informality of a Bed & Breakfast, along with all the amenities of a hotel. I arrived during the daily wine tasting/afternoon tea, and was invited to stay in the lobby and enjoy the refreshments. My room was on the ground floor, just off the lobby, a few feet from the delicious Sonoma Roasters coffee which was available all day and all evening. my room was the perfect size for one person, complete with a small terrace with a table & chairs, a fireplace, a comfortable bed, cable television, ample closet space and a bathroom with space for all the necessitiies, and a teddy bear for company. The staff were unfailingly helpful with suggestions for dining, transportation, and locating a pharmacy. The complimentary breakfast included new choices each day. I'm known for finding the perfect location in all my hotel choices (when you don't drive, location is very important). The location of the Inn on Broadway, only 2 blocks from the plaza, 3 blocks from an ATM, and 4 blocks from a shopping center which could meet any needs, was all I could ask for. I hope to have the opportunity to stay there again.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing hotel with excellent food

reviews.text: My husband and I were recently married in Sonoma. We, along with our family and friends,stayed at the Inn at Sonoma over the Labor Day weekend. I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms were very nice and clean and the staff was friendly and accommodating. It's a short walk from the town square where you'll find shops and restaurants. The breakfast was very good (buffet style). They have fresh cookies throughout the day and wine and snacks in the afternoon. Overall, a great stay.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time to Sonoma. We saw all the great reviews and had to stay here! The reviews were right on. From the minute we drove up until we checked out, we had a fabulous stay! The room was so cozy and cute, the bathroom was spa-like! They had wine and snacks after we checked in and recommended a great place for dinner and made our reservations for us. When we got back, our bed was turned down and we had mints on our pillows...such a nice touch! Breakfast was so good I had to talk to the chef and find out how she made the egg breakfast casserole...it was delicious with goat cheese! I will for sure stay here again the next time we come to Sonoma which can't be soon enough!! Loved it!
reviews.title: Can't wait to come back here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is the perfect stop for a few nights in Sonoma County. Centrally located, exceptionally personal staff, tastefully decorated rooms, and one heck of a complimentary wine-and-cheese hour made our anniversary one to remember.
reviews.title: Perfect Mix Between A Hotel and a B&B

likes.liked: — location to town square, tasty breakfast, winery discounts, wine hour at 4pm
likes.disliked: — no fridge in room, no pool, teddy bear that came to life at 3am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are under 30 and found Sonoma, in general, to be an older crowd. With that being said, the town square, (located 2 blocks / 4 min. away) has a terrific restaurant scene. Girl and the Fig was amazing for dinner and the Ledson hotel bar is equally as good for a nightcap.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a deluxe queen room with a nice sized porch that was perfect for relaxing after a day of wine tasting or for champagne toasts prior to going out to eat.
reviews.title: I love this place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returened from a wonderful 4 day stay in Sonoma. We have enjoyed two other Four Sisters' Inns and were pleased to see that there was one if Sonoma (near the wedding we attended).
reviews.title: Inn at Sonoma was a Great Experience

likes.disliked: — Didn't like the fact that they had USA Today rather than the Wall Street Journal--this is a very minor issue!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As has already been mentioned but needs additional emphasis, the location is outstanding. Easy to stroll up the street to the town square for wonderful meals, drinks, shopping, wine tasting, spa treatments, a movie--or nothing at all except people watching.
reviews.title: Wonderful Little Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were what I have come to expect from this great chain--yummy coffee, great baked goods, fresh fruit. We skipped lunch on most days as we didn't have room. The best surprise was that when I woke up at 5 am on the first day (still not in vacation mode!!)--there was hot coffee in the kitchen for me. Talk about surpassing my expectations!
reviews.title: Perfect get-away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some wonderful surprises:
reviews.title: Loved the Inn

reviews.text: It was possible to borrow bikes from the Inn and go on a very reasonable 13 mile ride to do wine tastings at 5 local wineries. The Inn also provided coupons for either half price or free tastings at all of them! What an amazing afternoon this turned out to be--easily the highlight of the trip.
reviews.title: Inn at Sonoma - definitely!

aka: Inn At Sonoma - a Four Sisters Hotel
description: Fall in love with the quiet pace, beautiful vistas and fabulous food and wine of the Sonoma Valley. Coupled with a year-round temperate climate, this is a wonderful place to explore - no matter what the season. Conveniently located just two blocks from the historic Sonoma Plaza, the Inn at Sonoma is the perfect destination for your Wine Country visit
